results.title: Caravan park
results.brief_description: Caravan Park is filmed both from the point of view of a small child and from an observer. A family of three is stranded in a caravan park when their car breaks down on the road home. A stray cat found near the car is taken as a good luck sign by the father and adopted by his son. As the family continues to struggle to make ends meet and get back on the road, the cat continues to be a sign of good luck for the father, until it dies. This is a slow paced narrative and requires careful examination of the characters to understand its purpose.

results.title: Captivated
results.creator_credit: David Squire, Piers Piers Godden and Dangerous to Know
results.brief_description: Written and performed by Rikki Beadle Blair, “Captivated” is a one-man theatre piece that tells the story of Shane, a gay black man imprisoned for murder. The monotony of his daily routine is broken by letters from a “pink” pen pal, a gay Asian man who writes to Shane as an act of charity. Their correspondence charts Shane’s personal journey from self-hatred, which has manifested in a personal history of violence, to agonised self-reflection, and finally a new found gratitude and respect for his unseen friend. Dynamically staged and produced, with a bravura performance of isolation and redemption by Blair, an award-winning actor and writer on British TV.

results.title: Capricious summer = Rozmarne leto [NTSC]
results.creator_credit: Jiri Menzel, Jan Libora, Ceskoslovensky Filmexport and Filmove Studio Barrandov
results.brief_description: At a second-rate, turn-of-the-century resort, the pool manager, an ex-mayor, and a priest spend the sleepy summer days swimming, drinking, eating and pontificating on Life in a flowery language — until an aerialist/magician and his beautiful “assistant” come to town. Each of the trio in turn becomes humiliatingly convinced that it is too late for an adventure. Based on a novel by the Czech writer Vladimir Vancura, ‘Capricious Summer’ displays the subtle atmosphere of a Jean Renoir film. A film of the Czech New Wave—an highly fertile period in Czech film history that was brutally repressed by the Soviet invasion in 1968. Cast includes Rudolf Hrusinsky, Vlastimil Brodsky, Frantisek Rehak, Mila Myslikova and Jiri Menzel as the aerialist/magician. (Award: Grand Prix, Karlovy Vary Film Festival)

results.title: Canto a la Vida = Song to Life
results.creator_credit: Lucia Salinas Briones, Gina Roncoli and Vida Media Productions
results.brief_description: During the sixteen year dictatorship of General Augusto Pinochet that ended with the 1989 democratic elections, over one million Chileans left their homeland to live in exile. “Canto a la vida” explores the experience of living a life in exile through the stories of seven Chilean woman. They include Tencia de Allende, the widow of the murdered president Salvadore Allende; internationally renowned folk singer, Isabel Parra; author Isabel Allende and artist Gracia Barrios. Directed by Lucia Salinas Brionas who exiled to Australia in 1986. (English and Spanish with English subtitles)

results.title: Canticle of the stones = Cantique des pierres [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Michel Khleifi, CBA, Channel 4, Radio Television Belge Francophone (RTBF), Sourat Films and Zweites Deutsches Fernsehen
results.brief_description: Using a cinema verite format, Palestinian director, Michel Khleifi (Wedding in Galilee 1987, Tale of the three jewels 1994, Forbidden marriages in the Holy Land 1995) juxtaposes a fictional story of rekindled love with the confronting reality of violence and despair in the streets of occupied Palestine. The two lovers, now in their forties, have been separated for over 15 years after he was arrested and imprisoned by the Israelis for his part in the Palestinian Resistance and she, bitter and disappointed, decided to immigrate to America. On her arrival back to Jerusalem to study the Intifada’s impact on Palestinian society she discovers that he has been released from prison and it is against this background of resistance and repression that the two once again find love. This is a powerful film, combining fiction and reality through the use of poetic dialogue intertwined with the harsh and violent images of the occupation and resistance and in Khleifi’s own words…”By mixing elements of reality with a fictional love-story, my intention was to oppose the perception of the “Other” as a dispensable abstraction and to give expression to the pain and torment through which Palestinians were living”. Highly acclaimed, winner of two international awards and official selection for the 1990 Cannes Film Festival. Cinematography by Raymond Fromont. In Arabic with English subtitles.
